title: Bristol City boss Lee Johnson facing axe if struggling Robins are beaten by Newcastle
text:
Sport Bristol City boss Lee Johnson facing axe if struggling Robins are beaten by Newcastle City have lost 10 of their last 13 matches to edge closer to the Championship drop zone and angry fans turned on Johnson after the defeat to Fulham Share Johnson finds himself under pressure (Photo: Paul Gilham) Share Get daily   Thank you for subscribing!   
Bristol City boss Lee Johnson is facing the sack if his side lose at Newcastle on Saturday. 
Chairman Steve Lansdown is ready to wield the axe after a dismal run of ten defeats in 13 games have left City fearing relegation from the Championship. 
Angry City supporters turned on Johnson during Wednesdayâ€™s 2-0 defeat at home to Fulham and have also started a petition calling for him to be given the boot. 
Lansdown is reluctant to bow to fan pressure but is worried by the financial implications of dropping back into League One after bankrolling a number of well-paid signings in January. 
Johnson has been in charge at Ashton Gate since February last year after leaving Barnsley to replace the sacked Steve Cotterill. He has vowed not to quit. poll loading Will Bristol City be relegated? 0+ VOTES SO FAR
